title: How to Make Cheesecake Pops

steps.headline: Grease and flour a 9 inch cake pan.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius).
In a large bowl, cream the sugar and cream cheese until smooth and fluffy.
Add the sour cream, flour, vanilla, and salt.
Crack in the eggs, one at a time, and cream again.
Pour and scrape the cream cheese batter onto the cake pan.
Bake the cake until it's golden brown, taking about 50 minutes.
Place the cake on a wire rack to cool for about 5 minutes.
Allow the cake to chill in the fridge for at least 3 hours.
Place your desired toppings into medium-sized bowls.
Scoop out the cheesecake into round balls using a mini ice cream scoop.
steps.description: Ensure the balls are 1-½ inch sized.

steps.headline: Place the cheesecake balls on a tray with waxed paper.
Place a lollipop stick into the middle of each cheesecake ball.
Freeze the cheesecake balls in the freezer for about 30 minutes.
Melt the white chocolate.
steps.description: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the white chocolate in a microwave, stirring every few seconds with a spoon. Microwave until the white chocolate fully melts and is smooth. You can also melt the white chocolate in a double boiler.

steps.headline: Dip the cheesecake balls into the melted chocolate.
steps.description: Twirl the cheesecake pop around to remove any excess chocolate.

steps.headline: Roll the cheesecake pops into the toppings and place them on a tray with waxed paper.
Chill the cheesecake pops into the fridge until the chocolate hardens.
Serve.
steps.description: Remove the cheesecake pops from the fridge and place them on a cake pop holder. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Baking the Cheesecake Grease and flour a 9 inch cake pan.  Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius).  In a large bowl, cream the sugar and cream cheese until smooth and fluffy.  Add the sour cream, flour, vanilla, and salt. Mix until well-combined. Crack in the eggs, one at a time, and cream again.  Pour and scrape the cream cheese batter onto the cake pan.  Bake the cake until it's golden brown, taking about 50 minutes.  Place the cake on a wire rack to cool for about 5 minutes.  Allow the cake to chill in the fridge for at least 3 hours.  Making the Cheesecake Pops Place your desired toppings into medium-sized bowls.  Scoop out the cheesecake into round balls using a mini ice cream scoop. Ensure the balls are 1-½ inch sized. Place the cheesecake balls on a tray with waxed paper.  Place a lollipop stick into the middle of each cheesecake ball.  Freeze the cheesecake balls in the freezer for about 30 minutes.  Melt the white chocolate. In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the white chocolate in a microwave, stirring every few seconds with a spoon. Microwave until the white chocolate fully melts and is smooth. You can also melt the white chocolate in a double boiler. Dip the cheesecake balls into the melted chocolate. Twirl the cheesecake pop around to remove any excess chocolate. Roll the cheesecake pops into the toppings and place them on a tray with waxed paper.  Chill the cheesecake pops into the fridge until the chocolate hardens.  Serve. Remove the cheesecake pops from the fridge and place them on a cake pop holder. Enjoy! Finished.
